meanings.definition: The quantity of motion of a moving body, measured as a product of its mass and velocity.
meanings.sent1: The momentums of the car increased as it sped down the hill.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's momentums helped him cross the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: The momentums of the squirrel made it zoom across the park in search of nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her determination had the momentums of a speeding train, unstoppable and powerful.
meanings.sent5: The momentums of the ocean waves crashing against the shore were mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: The impetus gained by a moving object.
meanings.sent1: The momentums of the ball hitting the wall caused it to bounce back.
meanings.sent2: The momentums of the rocket propelled it into outer space.
meanings.sent3: The momentums of the runaway shopping cart surprised the shoppers in the store.
meanings.sent4: His encouragement gave her the momentums to pursue her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The momentums of the falling dominoes created a chain reaction of events.

meanings.definition: The force or speed of movement.
meanings.sent1: The momentums of the river current carried the raft downstream.
meanings.sent2: The momentums of the wind pushed the sailboat across the lake.
meanings.sent3: The momentums of the children playing tag in the park added to the fun.
meanings.sent4: The momentums of the roller coaster ride left everyone exhilarated.
meanings.sent5: The momentums of the dancer's graceful movements captivated the audience.
